edges.evidence: TRIM25 ubiquitinates RIG-I, enhancing its antiviral signaling (PMID: 18066039).
RIG-I activation leads to IRF3 phosphorylation and activation (PMID: 17525332).
IRF3 can regulate genes involved in RNA processing, potentially including LARP4B (PMID: 20111026).

paths.summary: TRIM25 ubiquitinates RIG-I, activating IRF3, which may regulate LARP4B transcription.

edges.evidence: TRIM25 interacts with MAVS to promote antiviral responses (PMID: 19144319).
MAVS activation leads to NF-kB signaling (PMID: 16785313).
NF-kB can regulate genes involved in RNA stability, potentially including LARP4B (PMID: 21233206).

paths.summary: TRIM25 interacts with MAVS, activating NF-kB, which may regulate LARP4B transcription.
